str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be weak (physically: then morally), To be sick. From asthenes; to be feeble.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of persons: powerful, able, (b) of things: possible. From dunamai; powerful or capable; neuter possible.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To pray, wish. Middle voice of a primary verb; to wish; by implication, to pray to God.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A perfecting, making fit. From katartizo; thorough equipment.
